question: [File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Integer Overflow] Can passing idx=255 cause integer overflow when appended to type_name string, potentially creating colliding keys for different asset types? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [String Manipulation] Can malicious type names with special characters bypass key uniqueness checks when combined with idx, allowing asset ID collision in vault storage? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Type Confusion] Can two different generic types T1 and T2 with similar names produce identical keys when idx values differ, enabling asset substitution attacks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Key Collision] If idx wraps or is reused, can NaviAccountCap0 from different epochs collide, causing wrong asset retrieval from vault storage? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Format Consistency] Can inconsistent string formatting between type_name and idx.to_string() create parsing errors downstream in adaptor asset lookups? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Integer Overflow] Can v1 * v2 overflow u256 before division by DECIMALS when calculating large share amounts, causing transaction abort or incorrect minting? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Division by Zero] Although DECIMALS is constant 1e9, can any code path externally modify or bypass this causing division by zero in share calculations? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Precision Loss] When v1=1e18 and v2=1e18, does the intermediate multiplication overflow u256 max (2^256-1) before dividing by 1e9? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Rounding Down] Can rounding down in division cause cumulative loss over multiple operations, enabling attacker to drain small amounts repeatedly? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Truncation Attack] Can attacker craft v1 and v2 values where (v1*v2)/DECIMALS truncates to zero, bypassing minimum deposit/fee requirements? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Max Value Test] When v1=2^256-1 and v2=2, does overflow occur before division, causing panic in share price calculations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Sandwich Attack] Can attacker exploit rounding by sandwiching legitimate transactions, profiting from accumulated truncation errors? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Division by Zero] Can v2=0 be passed to div_d() in withdrawal calculations, causing transaction abort and DoS for vault operations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Integer Overflow] Can v1 * DECIMALS overflow u256 when v1 is near max, causing incorrect share-to-amount conversions during withdrawals? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Precision Inflation] Can attacker exploit (v1 * 1e9) / v2 to inflate shares when v2 is very small, minting excessive shares? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Rounding Attack] When v1=1 and v2=1e9+1, does result round to zero, allowing attacker to bypass minimum share requirements? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [First Depositor Attack] Can first depositor set v2 to very large value, causing all subsequent div_d() calls to round to zero? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Extreme Values] When v1=2^255 and multiplied by 1e9, does overflow occur, breaking share redemption calculations? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals()] [Integer Overflow] Can v * DECIMALS overflow u256 when v > 2^247, causing incorrect balance conversions in vault accounting? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals()] [Precision Error] Can converting raw amounts to decimal representation lose precision for amounts < 1e9, causing rounding to zero? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals()] [Inconsistent Units] Can mixing to_decimals() output with raw amounts in calculations cause unit confusion, leading to inflated balances? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals()] [Max Value Vulnerability] When v=2^256-1, does multiplication by 1e9 wrap around, creating negative-seeming values in accounting? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_decimals()] [Truncation Loss] Can v / DECIMALS truncate small values to zero, causing loss of user funds in micro-deposits? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_decimals()] [Round-Trip Error] Does to_decimals(from_decimals(x)) != x for values not divisible by 1e9, causing accounting discrepancies? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_decimals()] [Dust Accumulation] Can repeated from_decimals() calls accumulate truncated dust, which attacker claims by precise timing? (Medium)
